channel.title: Daily Paper Digest
channel.description: Algorithmically selected papers from 20+ journal feeds, focused on RF systems, cultural heritage conservation, and adjacent topics.

item.title: MVPTransformer: Long-Term Multivariate Time-Series Pattern for Plasma Array-Based Intelligent Protection Against HPM
item.description: In this work, we propose a novel time-series modeling approach that integrates multiperspective feature extraction with multihead attention-based information fusion, complemented by an autonomous thinking strategy (ATS). By conducting case studies and comparing our method with three state-of-the-art time-series models, we validate the superior accuracy and generalizability of our proposed approach. | Score: 6.14
item.author: Naixing Feng;Chunzhi Dong;Jianyuan Fu;Fanghua Zheng;Zhixiang Huang;

item.title: Adaptive FMCW Radar Interference Suppression via Coupled Range-Doppler Unsupervised Sparse Learning and Reconstruction
item.description: The simulation and multiple measured experiments demonstrate the proposed method achieves efficient interference suppression performance. Compared to state-of-the-art methods, the time required to process a single frame of measured data is only 0.0872 s, with the best interference suppression performance. | Score: 5.35
item.author: Hao Zhang;Shunjun Wei;Rui Min;Xiang Cai;Shuangqiao Li;Jin Li;Mou Wang;Jun Shi;Guolong Cui;

item.title: Training Signal Optimization for Behavioral Modeling and Digital Predistortion of RF Power Amplifiers
item.description: The signal is similar to orthogonal frequency-division multiplexing-based signal standards, facilitating its use in training during the regular operation of the wireless transmitter. Experimental validation of this method is also provided in hardware, with a PA using a 100-MHz bandwidth millimeter wave 5G signal. | Score: 5.27
item.author: Jonathan Guimaraes Ribeiro;Yiyue Jiang;Rahul Mushini;Miriam Leeser;John Dooley;

item.title: Efficient 3D Surface Super-Resolution via Normal-Based Multimodal Restoration
item.description: This paper introduces an efficient multimodal normal-based 3D surface super-resolution (mn3DSSR) framework, designed to address the challenges of microgeometry enhancement and computational overhead. Extensive experiments conducted on seven benchmark datasets across four different 3D data representations demonstrate that mn3DSSR consistently outperforms state-of-the-art super-resolution methods in terms of restoration accuracy with high computational efficiency. | Score: 1.88
item.author: Miaohui Wang;Yunheng Liu;Wuyuan Xie;Boxin Shi;Jianmin Jiang;

item.title: Uncertainty-Aware With Adaptive Geometric Correction for Multimodal Land-Cover Classification
item.description: We evaluate UAG on the WHU-OPT-SAR and DFC23 datasets, where experimental results demonstrate substantial improvements over state-of-the-art methods. The code will be released at https://github.com/cccwbin/UAGNet | Score: 4.54
item.author: Wenbin Cao;Xu Wang;Yi Xiao;Wenxin Huang;Bihan Wen;Xian Zhong;

item.title: Chirplet Fourier Analysis Network for Cross-Scene Classification of Multisource Remote Sensing Data
item.description: Extensive experiments demonstrate that the ChirpFAN framework achieves state-of-the-art (SOTA) performance with 3% average improvements on three challenging cross-scene MSRS datasets. The code is released on https://github.com/xudongzhao461/. | Score: 4.35
item.author: Xudong Zhao;Qi Ming;Yixiao Yang;Wenshuai Hu;Wei Li;Ran Tao;

item.title: Soil Moisture Affects Multitemporal InSAR Deformation Monitoring via Dielectric Property Changes
item.description: Our findings indicate that dielectric property changes constitute a critical factor in InSAR deformation monitoring that cannot be overlooked. This insight holds significant implications for enhancing the effectiveness of InSAR technology in slope disaster monitoring and early warning systems. | Score: 4.24
item.author: Meng Ao;Xiangben Zhang;Yuan Dai;Lianhuan Wei;Yian Wang;Xiaosong Feng;Shanjun Liu;Mingsheng Liao;Lu Z

item.title: Improving Ground Deformation Classification by Integrating InSAR Time Series With Geospatial Information
item.description: To fully use the rich information contained in the TS and to exploit the complementary strengths of spatial and temporal data, we propose a dual-branch deep learning (DL) approach that integrates InSAR ground deformation TS with geospatial information for classifying slow-moving ground deformation processes. This work highlights the strength of multimodal data fusion method to classify ground deformation processes, while setting the stage for future research. | Score: 4.20
item.author: Yingbo Dong;Lorenzo Nava;Riccardo Palamà;Oriol Monserrat;Davide Festa;Mario Floris;Ascanio Rosi;Fili

item.title: U-SET: Uncertainty-Aware SAR-to-EO Translation
item.description: By leveraging the uncertainty estimation capabilities of deep-learning models, U-SET effectively prioritizes structurally complex and ambiguous regions during training. Comprehensive evaluations on our newly compiled KOMPSAT dataset demonstrate that U-SET achieves state-of-the-art performance, outperforming existing methods across six image quality metrics in both quantitative and qualitative assessments. | Score: 3.56
item.author: Minyoung Jeon;Hyun-Ho Kim;Juheon Park;Doochun Seo;Jaehyup Lee;

item.title: Charting the Future: A Review Of Comsoc's Strategic TC Restructuring
item.description: Led by the Vice President (VP-TEA), the TEA Council oversees several important boards – including the Educational Services Board (ESB), Industry Communities Board (ICB), and Technical Committees Board (TCB) – as well as vital standing committees. They will share details on the comprehensive Technical Committee restructuring, which the Board of Governors approved in June 2025. | Score: nan
item.author: Robert Schober;Wei Zhang;Shiwen Mao;
